title: Organic & Native Planting
intro: Restore local ecology with plants that belong here. Pollinator-friendly gardens that require less water and zero chemical fertilizers.
highlights: Butterfly and pollinator gardens (Milkweed, Lantana, Salvia)
Shade-tolerant native groundcovers for staying green under oaks
Seasonal color installation using adaptive species
Soil microorganism restoration with organic compost teas

avgCost.notes: Planting projects vary by container size (1-gallon vs 15-gallon) and quantity.

faqs.a: Native gardens can be wild or manicured. Teams use intentional grouping and edging to ensure your landscape looks maintained and purposeful.
Professionals may use both organic and chemical fertilizers depending on your plants' needs and your preferences. Discuss your approach to fertilization with your chosen provider.
